cluster_classes.class_description: Operating and loading conditions that drive thermal fatigue in metallic components, including cyclic stresses arising from temperature changes and repeated thermal cycling.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Thermal fatigue is the result of cyclic stresses caused by variations in temperature... particularly under repeated thermal cycling.

members.entity_description: Repeatedly varying mechanical stresses that arise due to changing temperatures in components.
Changes in temperature over time that induce cyclic stresses in metallic components.
Repeated heating and cooling cycles that subject components to alternating thermal stresses.

cluster_classes.class_description: Physical phenomena involving constrained mechanical or thermal deformation between regions or parts of a component (such as relative movement or differential expansion) that can lead to cracking, especially under repeated thermal cycling.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Cracking may occur where relative movement or differential expansion is constrained, particularly under repeated thermal cycling.

members.entity_description: Mechanical motion between different parts or regions of a component that may be constrained.
Non-uniform thermal expansion between different regions of a component that can be constrained.

cluster_classes.class_description: Damage mechanism in metallic components caused by cyclic thermal stresses leading to cracking under constrained conditions.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Thermal fatigue is the result of cyclic stresses caused by variations in temperature… damage is in the form of cracking.

members.entity_description: Damage mechanism in metals caused by cyclic thermal stresses leading to cracking under constrained conditions.

cluster_classes.class_description: Fracture-type damage in metallic components caused by constrained differential expansion under repeated thermal cycling.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Fracture-type damage forming in metallic components as a manifestation of thermal fatigue.

members.entity_description: Fracture-type damage forming in metallic components as a manifestation of thermal fatigue.

cluster_classes.class_description: Metal structural or mechanical part that can experience constrained movement or differential expansion, making it susceptible to thermal fatigue cracking under repeated thermal cycling.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Any metal structural or mechanical part susceptible to thermal fatigue cracking where relative movement or differential expansion is constrained.

members.entity_description: Any metal structural or mechanical part susceptible to thermal fatigue cracking.

args.justification: This class describes operating/loading conditions (cyclic stresses from temperature changes and thermal cycling) that specifically drive thermal fatigue in metallic components, so it should be grouped under a domain-level Class_Group for thermal fatigue in metals.

This class captures constrained thermal/mechanical deformation phenomena (relative movement, differential expansion) that cause cracking under repeated thermal cycling in metallic components, fitting the same overarching thermal fatigue in metals domain.
This class explicitly represents the thermal fatigue damage mechanism in metallic components, making the shared Class_Group 'Thermal Fatigue in Metallic Components' appropriate.

This class represents the cracking morphology that manifests from thermal fatigue in metallic components, and should share the same higher-level Class_Group with the associated mechanism and conditions.

This class defines the metallic components that are susceptible to thermal fatigue cracking under the described conditions and phenomena, so it belongs in the same thermal fatigue in metallic components Class_Group.

executed_decisions.justification: This class describes operating/loading conditions (cyclic stresses from temperature changes and thermal cycling) that specifically drive thermal fatigue in metallic components, so it should be grouped under a domain-level Class_Group for thermal fatigue in metals.

This class explicitly represents the thermal fatigue damage mechanism in metallic components, making the shared Class_Group 'Thermal Fatigue in Metallic Components' appropriate.

This class represents the cracking morphology that manifests from thermal fatigue in metallic components, and should share the same higher-level Class_Group with the associated mechanism and conditions.

This class defines the metallic components that are susceptible to thermal fatigue cracking under the described conditions and phenomena, so it belongs in the same thermal fatigue in metallic components Class_Group.
